required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I Study of Ixabepilone in Combination With Capecitabine in Japanese Patients With Metastatic Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study of Ixabepilone in Combination With Capecitabine in Japanese Patients With Metastatic Breast Cancer Previously Treated With an Anthracycline and a Taxane

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the dose-limiting toxicity (DLT), maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and recommended Phase II dose of ixabepilone in combination with capecitabine in Japanese participants with metastatic breast cancer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of drug through last day of Cycle 2 (Day 42)
primary_outcome.description: DLT was defined as any ixabepilone and/or capecitabine related events requiring study discontinuation during the first two treatment cycles.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants Achieving the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) and Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D)
primary_outcome.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose evaluated for which less than 1/3 of the participants experienced DLT during the first two treatment cycles. If toxicities (e.g. hand-foot syndrome, existing peripheral neuropathy, etc.) occurred or became more severe in later cycles, the recommended Phase II dose was to be determined after due consideration of their severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: AE = any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE = any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event. Treatment-related=Possible, Probable, or Certain relationship to drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant Tumor Response at Study Endpoint
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after every 42 days (every 2 21-day cycles) after baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor response was assessed using the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) in which complete response (CR) = disappearance of all target lesions; partial response (PR) = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; progressive disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; and stable disease (SD) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Ixabepilone Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) in One Dosing Interval
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Cycle 1 at specified timepoints (Day 1 to Day 8).
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax = maximum observed plasma concentration of ixabepilone as determined from participant serum samples in one dosing interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Ixabepilone Area Under the Concentration Curve (AUC INF) in One Dosing Interval
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Cycle 1 at specified timepoints (Day 1 to Day 8).
secondary_outcome.description: AUC = the average area under the concentration curve (AUC [INF]) of ixabepilone as determined from participant serum samples in one dosing interval over 24 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Ixabepilone Terminal Elimination Half Life (T 1/2) in One Dosing Interval
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Cycle 1 at specified timepoints (Day 1 to Day 8).
secondary_outcome.description: T 1/2 = terminal elimination half life as determined from participant serum samples in one dosing interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Ixabepilone Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) in One Dosing Interval
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Cycle 1 at specified timepoints (Day 1 to Day 8).
secondary_outcome.description: Vss = volume of distribution at steady state determined from participant serum samples from one dosing interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Ixabepilone Total Body Clearance (CLT) in One Dosing Interval
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Cycle 1 at specified timepoints (Day 1 to Day 8).
secondary_outcome.description: CLT = total body clearance as determined from participant serum samples in one dosing interval.

intervention.description: Ixabepilone: Intravenous (IV) Solution, IV, 32(40)mg/m^2, once every 3 weeks, up to 6 cycles
Capecitabine: Tablets, Oral, 1650(2000)mg/m^2, twice daily for 2 weeks, one week off, up to 6 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women ≥ 20 years
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of adenocarcinoma originating in the breast
Exclusion Criteria:
- Number of prior chemotherapy lines of treatment in the metastatic setting ≥3

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from 4 sites in Japan.

group.title: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 + Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/Day
group.description: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

group.title: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 + Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/Day
group.description: After receiving Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 + Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/Day, the dose was escalated such that participants received Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

group.title: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 + Capecitabine 2000 mg/m^2/Day
group.description: After receiving Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 + Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/Day, the dose was escalated such that participants received Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 2000 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

group.title: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 + Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/Day
group.description: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 2000 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Participants Experiencing Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT)
outcome.description: DLT was defined as any ixabepilone and/or capecitabine related events requiring study discontinuation during the first two treatment cycles.
outcome.time_frame: From initiation of drug through last day of Cycle 2 (Day 42)
outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of either ixabepilone or capecitabine.

group.title: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 + Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/Day
group.description: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

group.description: Ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 2000 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

measure.description: DLT was defined as any ixabepilone and/or capecitabine related events requiring study discontinuation during the first two treatment cycles.
measure.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of either ixabepilone or capecitabine.

outcome.title: Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: AE = any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE = any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event. Treatment-related=Possible, Probable, or Certain relationship to drug
outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of either ixabepilone or capecitabine.

group.description: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

measure.title: Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: AE = any new untoward medical occurrence/worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE = any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event. outcome.title: Participant Tumor Response at Study Endpoint
outcome.description: Tumor response was assessed using the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) in which complete response (CR) = disappearance of all target lesions; partial response (PR) = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; progressive disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; and stable disease (SD) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline and after every 42 days (every 2 21-day cycles) after baseline
outcome.population: All treated participants with measurable disease and tumor response.

group.title: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 + Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/Day
group.description: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each 21-day treatment cycle.

measure.description: Tumor response was assessed using the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) in which complete response (CR) = disappearance of all target lesions; partial response (PR) = 30% decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; progressive disease (PD) = 20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; and stable disease (SD) = small changes that do not meet above criteria.
measure.population: All treated participants with measurable disease and tumor response.

outcome.description: Cmax = maximum observed plasma concentration of ixabepilone as determined from participant serum samples in one dosing interval.
outcome.time_frame: During Cycle 1 at specified timepoints (Day 1 to Day 8).
outcome.population: All participants who received ixabepilone and capecitabine and who had adequate PK concentration profiles.

outcome.title: Participants Achieving the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) and Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D)
outcome.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose evaluated for which less than 1/3 of the participants experienced DLT during the first two treatment cycles. If toxicities (e.g. hand-foot syndrome, existing peripheral neuropathy, etc.) occurred or became more severe in later cycles, the recommended Phase II dose was to be determined after due consideration of their severity.
outcome.population: All participants treated at the highest dose level.

group.title: All Participants With Measurable Disease and Tumor Response
group.description: The evaluable participant population consisted of participants who met the minimum safety evaluation requirements of the study: participant received ≥ 1 dose of ixabepilone and/or capecitabine in Cycle 1, completed adequate safety evaluations, and was observed for ≥ 21 days following the first dose or the participant experienced DLT.

measure.title: Participants Achieving the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) and Recommended Phase 2 Dose (RP2D)
measure.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose evaluated for which less than 1/3 of the participants experienced DLT during the first two treatment cycles. If toxicities (e.g. hand-foot syndrome, existing peripheral neuropathy, etc.) occurred or became more severe in later cycles, the recommended Phase II dose was to be determined after due consideration of their severity.
measure.population: All participants treated at the highest dose level.

group.title: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 + Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/Day
group.description: Ixabepilone 32 mg/m^2 was administered via intravenous (IV) infusion over 3 hours on Day 1 of each 21-day treatment cycle. Capecitabine 1650 mg/m^2/day was administered on Days 1 to 14 of each treatment cycle.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
